intro: Corethrogyne filaginifolia var. pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific corethrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and northern Baja California. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along the shoreline. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
